intro: Medinilla forbesii, commonly known as the velvet tangerine plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. Medinilla forbesii is also valued for its ability to bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions.
